title: 115_s2375
content: The Equifax Consumer Protection and Data Empowerment Act of 2018, also known as the Fair Credit Reporting Act, includes a new section for the protection of credit information of consumers. The Equifax Consumer Protection and Data Empowerment Act of 2018 introduces secure, cost-free file locks for consumers provided by consumer reporting agencies. This method allows consumers to control the release of their information for credit, insurance, or financial account purposes. The Equifax Consumer Protection and Data Empowerment Act of 2018 introduces a method for consumer reporting agencies to collect only necessary information to prevent the release of consumer information. Information collected must only be used for specified purposes, and consumers cannot be required to waive rights or indemnify the agency. The Equifax Consumer Protection and Data Empowerment Act of 2018 prohibits the use of consumer information for marketing or advertising purposes. It allows individuals with a relationship to the consumer to access information for account review or collection. The Bureau must establish regulations within 18 months of the enactment of the Act.
